intro: Cyrtandra olaaensis, commonly known as the Olaa Mountain Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments on the slopes of the Olaa Mountains. Its leaves are opposite and lanceolate, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
